hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
# Template1_20180824
# Get list of resources locked by this build. RESOURCES=${RESOURCES:-$(cd ${JENKINS_HOME} && ./resourceslockedby.py ${JOB_BASE_NAME}#${BUILD_NUMBER})}
# Create csv header. :> plot.csv for R in ${RESOURCES}; do echo -n \"${R}.user\", >> plot.csv echo -n \"${R}.system\", >> plot.csv echo -n \"${R}.elapsed\", >> plot.csv done truncate --size=-1 plot.csv echo >> plot.csv
TIMEOUT=3600 ITERATIONS=8
# Remove failure flags if any. rm -rf *.failed
# Run test on each resource. for R in ${RESOURCES}; do # In order to execute in parallel, each # ressource test run within its own subshell. ( # Reboot resource. (cd ${JENKINS_HOME} && ./rebootresource.sh jenkins@${R} &> /dev/null)
echo "${R}: $(ssh -q jenkins@${R} 'uname -r')" > ${R}.kernelrelease timeout -sKILL ${TIMEOUT} ssh -q jenkins@${R} &> ${R}.ssh.log <<-EOF || touch ${R}.failed set -e cat > ${JOB_BASE_NAME}.yaml <<-NESTEDEOF iteration: !mux default: runs: ${ITERATIONS} NESTEDEOF sudo avocado run avocado-misc-tests/kernel/kernbench.py -m ${JOB_BASE_NAME}.yaml EOF AVOCADO_LOG_PATH=$(cat ${R}.ssh.log | fgrep 'JOB LOG' | grep -oP '(?<=: ).+$') if [ -n "${AVOCADO_LOG_PATH}" ]; then scp jenkins@${R}:${AVOCADO_LOG_PATH} ${R}.avocado.log fi if [ ! -e ${R}.failed ]; then CPUCNT=$(ssh -q jenkins@${R} grep -c '^processor' /proc/cpuinfo) userplotval=$(echo \($(cat ${R}.avocado.log | fgrep 'User ' | grep -oP '(?<= : )[0-9.]+$') / ${ITERATIONS}\) / ${CPUCNT} | bc -l) systemplotval=$(echo \($(cat ${R}.avocado.log | fgrep 'System ' | grep -oP '(?<= : )[0-9.]+$') / ${ITERATIONS}\) / ${CPUCNT} | bc -l) elapsedplotval=$(echo $(cat ${R}.avocado.log | fgrep 'Elapsed ' | grep -oP '(?<= : )[0-9.]+$') / ${ITERATIONS} | bc -l) # Average with previous values if available, # in an attempt to remove noise from plots. # It is enough to test for the existance # of a single previous value. if [ -f ${R}.user.prevplotval ]; then userplotval=$(echo \($(cat ${R}.user.prevplotval)+${userplotval}\)/2 | bc -l) systemplotval=$(echo \($(cat ${R}.system.prevplotval)+${systemplotval}\)/2 | bc -l) elapsedplotval=$(echo \($(cat ${R}.elapsed.prevplotval)+${elapsedplotval}\)/2 | bc -l) fi echo -n ${userplotval} > ${R}.user.prevplotval echo -n ${systemplotval} > ${R}.system.prevplotval echo -n ${elapsedplotval} > ${R}.elapsed.prevplotval echo -n ${userplotval} > ${R}.user.plotval echo -n ${systemplotval} > ${R}.system.plotval echo -n ${elapsedplotval} > ${R}.elapsed.plotval fi ) & done
# Wait for all subshells. wait
# Generate "Kernel Release:" line for # the "Set Build Description" plugin. echo -n "Kernel Release: " > kernelreleases for R in ${RESOURCES}; do if [ -f ${R}.kernelrelease ]; then echo -n "$(cat ${R}.kernelrelease 2>/dev/null), " >> kernelreleases fi done truncate --size=-2 kernelreleases echo [$(cat kernelreleases)]
# Finalize csv with plot values. for R in ${RESOURCES}; do echo -n "$(cat ${R}.user.plotval 2>/dev/null)," >> plot.csv echo -n "$(cat ${R}.system.plotval 2>/dev/null)," >> plot.csv echo -n "$(cat ${R}.elapsed.plotval 2>/dev/null)," >> plot.csv done truncate --size=-1 plot.csv echo >> plot.csv
# This is the last command so as # to be the script exit status. test ! -e *.failed
